biotools.summary: Count the occurrences of k-mers in biological sequences (Fastq or Fasta formatted). It can then perform various analyses on the generated indices. The counting is resource intensive, but this tool can divide the computation up, so that it can be run as sequential parts (to fit in memory), in parallel (to exploit multiple CPUs), or distributed (to use a cluster of computers).
